revised_title: Investigating the Heat Generation and Temperature Changes in Cotton Due to Water and Water Vapour Immersion
tldr: The author investigates the heat generation and temperature changes in cotton when immersed in water and saturated water vapour. The study reveals that the heat production is due to the condensation of water vapour on the cotton fibres, and the observed temperature changes are significantly influenced by the initial dryness of the cotton and the surrounding conditions.
